column2: chloe, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 56 yrs. old and have been taking stalevo 50 2pills 2 times a day. I feel better since I started taking 4 months ago. i had stiffness, pain in my hips, I still have my left leg tense up and shake, i still have a shaky jaw occasionally and have gained 10 lbs.

column2: bevkaytom, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
zackabenie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am a 54 yr old female and just got the diagnosis (Parkingsons)and started 50mg Stalevo, moved to 100mg 2 days ago.  I am also taking lamictol 100mg and wellbutrin 150mg (for bi-polar).  In last several days I have felt severe agitation (boarding on rage with regular things) Is this a side ffect that anyone else is/haw had.  thanks

column2: carole, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i just started stalevo 50 mg. last week,and i find i fall asleep during the day a lot,i am 64 y.does this subside?

column2: motto, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Stalevo has given me back all the abilitiess to talk effectively and with the knowledge I know what I am doing. The other symptons have not disappeared but are not as bad as before taking the medication.  Knowing others in a support group I find this is a great medication for my body.

column2: rose gonzales, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: muy azonsada y lenta rebuelta el estomago

column2: Dan S., 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: For myself, it only works ( Stalevo 100 )in combination with Artane. I tried both of these drugs separately and did not have much relief with either of them, but together they work well.

column2: Bill T, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took this for  about one week before my Dr. upped me to 100 mgs.  In both cases I found little positive and some negative reaction.  I've had joint pain, which is new.  I'm also on Azilect, and have tried ReQuip and Meripex, neither of which caused much change.

column2: boopzbetty, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: My mother is the one taking this medication. She has gone to the dr repeatedly and told her it is not helping her and she will not change her medication to something else. I do not understand why but I do know my mother is very frustrated and even wants to quit going to the Dr because of this.

column2: Richard, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Best control of tremors in 2 years. Easy to take and works great.

column2: bud, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I moved from Requip to Neupro and Stalevo 50 3x.  It seems to be working, but some symptoms are still obvious.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Took it as a test, and it worked well.  I am in early stage Parkinsons.

column2: Bud Angus, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Replaced ReQuip to avoid sleepiness during driving, golfing, etc.

column2: gale, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Has helped concentration. Been taking since January 07. Not much change in other symptoms.

column9: trouble sleeping- I take stalevo for ataxia and symptoms of Parkinsons

column2: boyntonbeachgirl, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: the only thing I find difficult is having to take the medication 4 times a day and 1/2 hour before eating.  Otherwise it is a great treatment for tremors.
